div.l: The Cook of london / whil the Reeve spak
For Ioye him thouht he clawed hym on the bak
Ha · ha · he seid / for crystys passioıı̄un
This myller hath a sharp conclusioıı̄un
Vppon his argument of herbergage
Wel seid salamon in his langage
Ne bryng nat euꝰery man to thyn hous
To ben herberwed for it is perlious
Wel auht a man / avised for to be
Whom that he brouht / in to his pryvite
I pray to god so yeve me sorwoe and care
Iif ever sythen / I hyhte hogge of ware
Herde y bettir myllermylermyller / set a werke
He hadde a Iape of malys in the derke
But god for bede that we styntyn her
And therfor / yf ye vouchesaff to heer
A tale of me that am a pore man
I wol you telle / as wel as evir y can
A litel Iape / that fil yn our Cyte
Our host answerde / and seid y graunte the
Now telle on rogeer / look that it be good
For many a pasti / hast thou letyn̄ blood
And many a Iakke of dovyr / hast thou solde
That hath be twyes hot / and twyes colde
Of many a pylgrym / hast thou crystis curs
For of thi persely yit fare they the wovrs
That they yet wyth thi stubbed goos
For in thy shoop / goth mony a fly los
Now telle on gentyl Rogger / bi thy name
But yet y pray the / be nat wroth for game
A man may sey ful soth / in game and play
Thou saist ful soth / ꝙquod Roger bi my fay
